text.text: What is the purpose of checking coverage status (eligibility) for patients' insurance?

text: The purpose of checking coverage status (eligibility) for patients' insurance is to ensure that the insurance is correct and to verify that the patient has coverage. You can check eligibility on any insurance whether it was recently acquired or already in the system.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle insurance eligibility checks?

text: ZOLL Billing checks with AR Boost around three AM UTC. If the claim is not already queued, ZOLL Billing checks data from AR Boost in the following cases: When you complete a claim in manual claim creation When you update a payer on the Claim page Anytime you run the eligibility check on the Claim page.

text.text: Can users manually initiate an eligibility check for a specific payer?

text: Yes, users can manually initiate an eligibility check for a specific payer.

text.text: What are the possible outcomes or responses from an eligibility check?

text: If the response is 'Inactive', the claim status changes to "Suspended - Inactive coverage". If the response is "Not found", the claim status changes to "Suspended - Verify coverage".

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle different eligibility statuses such as "Eligible," "Not eligible," "Inactive," and "Not found"?

text: If the response is 'Eligible', the claim status changes to "Active". If the response is 'Not eligible', the claim status changes to "Suspended - Not eligible".

text.text: Is there a process for mapping custom payer names to the corresponding payers in the ZOLL Eligibility service?

text: When you run eligibility on a payer for the first time, you will be presented with a window that allows you to map your custom payer name to the corresponding payer in the ZOLL Eligibility service.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle cases where the payer name in the system does not match the legal name in the eligibility service?

text: When you run eligibility and then leave the page, the coverage status will read 'Not verified'.

text.text: Can users review the eligibility status for each payer on the Coordination of Benefits tab of the Claim page?

text: Yes, users can review the eligibility status for each payer on the Coordination of Benefits tab of the Claim page. For every payer, under the "Coverage status" column you will either see a status with an icon next to it or "Not verified.

text.text: What actions can users take based on the eligibility status displayed for a payer?

text: Based on the eligibility status displayed for a payer, users can take the following actions: If the status is "Eligible", the claim can be submitted. If the status is "Not eligible", the claim cannot be submitted. If the status is "Inactive", the claim cannot be submitted and the payer must be updated. If the status is "Not found", the claim cannot be submitted and the payer must be added.

text.text: Are there any automated notifications or alerts triggered based on the eligibility status of a payer?

text: In order to collect on a claim, send an eligibility request, or forward a remittance, the Payer ID must be 100% correct.

text.text: How often should eligibility checks be performed for patients' insurance?

text: Eligibility checks should be performed anytime you run the eligibility check on the Claim page. On a nightly bases, ZOLL Billing checks with AR Boost around three AM UTC.

text.text: Can users access detailed response information from eligibility checks, such as response codes and descriptions?

text: Yes, users can access detailed response information from eligibility checks, such as response codes and descriptions.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing ensure data security and compliance when handling sensitive insurance information during eligibility checks?

text: ZOLL Billing uses the Patient Demographic Verifier to limit the risk of incorrect patient data. The confidence score is based on matching the current patient information with the returned information.

text.text: Running coverage status from the Claim page

text: You can run coverage status anytime from the Claim page > " Coordination of benefits " tab.

text.text: What to do if you get a not eligible response

text: If you get a not eligible response, you can run coverage status anytime from the Claim page > " Coordination of benefits " tab.

text.text: Matching your payer name with payer in Eligibility service

text: Before you can determine coverage status, you need to match the payer listed in your records to a payer listed in our eligibility service. You only have to do this once. The system will remember the matching from this point forward.

text.text: "Coverage status" indicates the status of the eligibility check

text: Correct. "Coverage status" indicates the status of the eligibility check.
You can run Coverage Status when you think you know the patient's insurance but need to verify it, or you are sure the patient has insurance but you are missing information.

text.text: Matching your payer name with payer in Eligibility service

text: Before you can determine coverage status, you need to match the payer listed in your records to a payer listed in our eligibility service. You only have to do this once. The system will remember the matching from this point forward.
